turn.0: ELI5: Chickens are constantly called living dinosaurs. Why aren’t Bats, Snakes, Apes ,Turtles...mostly all animals called living dinosaurs if there were versions of that same animal walking the earth millions of years ago?
turn.1: Because chickens and birds are actually directly descended from dinosaurs while mammals are descended from rat like things that lived alongside dinosaurs, and other reptiles are cousins of dinosaurs
turn.2: Lived alongside Dinos is what’s confusing me here. So you got the Reptiles and Rat like things sharing the same earth together but only one is called a dinosaur? I just thought that meant old ass animal that was around before the comet hit.
turn.3: No, dinosaurs is a specific classification  And it was an asteroid not a comet
turn.4: I’m a 33 year old man who just learned “dinosaur” doesn’t mean what i thought I didn’t since my first coloring book , I don’t think I have it in me to learn the truth behind the Asteroids and Comets scandal.
turn.5: A comet is an icy thing in space that flies very close to the sun every few decades/centuries and back out to the edge of the solar system. The sublimating ice is what causes the tail to form.  An asteroid is a rocky thing in space. It usually is in a stable-ish orbit and it does not sublimate
